ygData.subject: Re: KoS list
ygData.msgSnippet: Great idea. Here s what I know so far: Be careful in Butcherblok. All guards, and all NPC s at the dock *will* KOS, but there are ways around it if your
ygData.messageBody:
Great idea. Here's what I know so far:

Be careful in Butcherblok. All guards, and all NPC's at the dock *will* KOS,
but there are ways around it if your swimming's up to par.

Forget about the western half of Antonica until you're strong enough to make
it through Highhold pass alive. The guards in Rivervale(Death to all
halflings) will KOS, although the 2nd time this happened to me, they conned
"look at you threateningly" rather than "scowling and ready to attack", so
faction does improve(Kill orcs. lots of em).

Kithicor Forest: The Merchants in the first cabin to the right would sell to
me. /conned "apprehensive". The inkeep at the next cabin to your left will
KOS, but only if you walk through the door. On my way back to loot myself, i
was able to open the door, see him staring at me, and /summon safely.
-----Original Message-----
From: cltrhelm <cltrhelm@...>
To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, April 23, 1999 11:36 AM
Subject: [eq_shadowknights] KoS list


>From: cltrhelm <cltrhelm@...>
>
> I know some might think this may be a spoiler of sorts, but anyone
>interested in making a list of NPC's that KoS SK's? I know that factions
>play a role in some SK's getting killed by a NPC, but there are some
>that will kill us immediately no matter what we do.
> The only reason why I personally do not feel this a spoiler is
>because of this simple reason. If this were a real world (and when I am
>playing, I guess it is) I would definitely think that SK's would have
>some sort of network to relay this exact type of info. Also, NPC's can
>see us through walls, so if I would have known that the 1st inn in
>Western Karanas had an Innkeeper that will kill me immediately, I would
>have given it a little wider distance :).
> I know that /con is a great way to tell if someone will kill you if
>you make contact, but sometimes that is not possible i.e. in the middle
>of a fight. If I could just see the name of an NPC strolling towards me
>while I am engaged in combat, I would have a little more time to create
>some distance. Just as I do whenever a Griff or Giant comes a little to
>close to a confrontation I may be having with a band of couple bandits.
>
>Anyway, comments? bad idea? good idea?
>
>Reanin 14th level Human SK
>Cazic Thule
>
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>Did you know that ONElist hosts some of the largest lists on the Internet?

Internet!
